17.title: Mutt & Jeff [videorecording]
17.author: [No author]
notes: 1 videocassette (30 min.) : sd., col. ; 1/2 in.
(Cartoon Favorites)
VHS.
A collection of four cartoons from various producers.

Summary (from OCLC): "Westard Whoa": Mutt and Jeff find branding cattle in the West to be a challenge ; "Farm Foolery": Farm animals help with the harvest ; "Jungle Jitters": A salesman in the jungle prefers cannibals to marriage ; "Farm Frolics": Feuding farm animals sing 'She'll be comin' round the mountain.'

67.heading: Mutt and Jeff--Articles About.
67.title: "Bud Fisher and the Daily Comic Strip"
67.author: Robert C
67.appears_in: Harvey, p. 14-25 in Inks, v. 1, no. 1 (Feb. 1994) 1. Fisher, Bud. 2. Mutt and Jeff. I. Harvey, Robert C. Call no.: PN6700.I45v.1, no.1

68.heading: Mutt and Jeff--Articles About.
68.title: "Bud Fisher et l'Invention du Strip Quotidien"
68.author: Robert C
68.appears_in: Harvey ; adapté de l'américain par Jean-Pierre Mercier. p. 86-95 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 1 (Jan. 1996).
notes: Begins: "L'un des classiques de la bande dessinée de presse américaine, Mutt and Jeff fut la série qui imposa une formule éditoriale appelée à devenir canonique, celle d'une parution au rythme d'une bande par jour. Bud Fisher créa en 1907 cette oeuvre à maints égards inaugurale, dont le public français, faut d'avoir pu la lire, n'a pas vraiment mesuré jusqu'ici l'importance historique."

English summary (from p. 139): "Bud Fisher and the Invention of the Daily Strip. Though still famous in the United States, the couple Mutt and Jeff is practically unknown in France. Robert C. Harvey recalls the historic role played by this Bud Fisher series, which imposed the daily strip formula in 1907. He analyses the themes and the humour of the series, and remembers the numerous innovations owed to Fisher, and his fight for the rights of cartoonists working for the press."

114.heading: Mutt and Jeff--Miscellanea.
114.title: "The People Laugh"
114.author: John W

notes: Summary: Discussion of humor magazines, comedians, satire and comics, with sample illustrations by Clare Briggs (When a Feller Needs a Friend), John Held Jr., Charles Schulz (Peanuts), R.F. Outcault (The Yellow Kid, Buster Brown), F. Opper (Happy Hooligan), R. Dirks (The Katzenjammer Kids), George McManus (Bringing Up Father), Bud Fisher (Mutt and Jeff), Frank King (Gasoline Alley), and mention of others.

notes: Summary: It's top-of-the-line mutt chow, but Farley won't eat anything people won't eat. Michael tries to set a good example.

notes: Fourth in a sequence of six.

144.heading: Mutti.
144.title: "Briefing" p. 28-29 in Carpe Noctem
144.author: Jamiri.
notes: Summary (by M. Harbeck): In a parody on the advertising business Jamiri presents an advertisement for the fragrance "Mutti" (mommy) for crabby, overweight men who won't change to a fat-free lifestyle (with reference to photographer Herb Ritts).

151.title: Mutt and Jeff
notes:
Newspaper comic strip originated by Bud Fisher. See also the feature which preceded this one, A. Mutt and the spinoff feature Cicero's Cat . Mutt and Jeff strips were also reprinted as a feature in
